episodes.title: The other Queen of Canada
episodes.description: In this episode, we explore the bizarre and disturbing world of Romana Didulo, a self-proclaimed “Queen of Canada” and a leader of a fringe QAnon-linked movement. Didulo claims to have been appointed by the “White Hats” and the “Galactic Federation” to overthrow the Canadian government and establish a new kingdom. She also promotes various conspiracy theories, such as the COVID-19 pandemic being a hoax, the existence of a global cabal of satanic pedophiles, and the imminent arrival of a “Great Awakening” that will usher in a new era of peace and prosperity. We also look at the school they inhabited for a while. Join us as we journey to the fringe of reality and reason, and uncover the truth behind Romana Didulo, the Queen of Canada.

episodes.title: The epoch of its time: The Falun Gong part 3 of 3
episodes.description: In the third part of this trilogy we focus on the companies that Falun Gong has out there making them bank. We're talking truesurf, the Epoch Times and Shen Yun. It was worth the listen to get here!

episodes.title: The epoch of its time: The Falun Gong part 2 of 3
episodes.description: In this episode of Journey to the Fringe, we explore the controversial teachings of Falun Gong, a Chinese spiritual movement that claims to offer a path to enlightenment and salvation. We examine the origins and evolution of Falun Gong’s founder and leader, Li Hongzhi, who is revered by his followers as a god-like figure with supernatural powers. We also look at some of the most contentious and bizarre aspects of Falun Gong’s doctrine, such as its rejection of modern science, race mixing, medicine, and art, its denunciation of homosexuality, feminism, and worldly pursuits, and its belief in the imminent end of the world and the salvation of the chosen ones. Join us as we delve into the fringe of Falun Gong’s teachings, a journey that will challenge your assumptions and beliefs

episodes.title: The epoch of its time: The Falun Gong part 1 of 3
episodes.description: In this episode of Journey to the Fringe, we explore the history of Falun Gong, a spiritual movement that emerged in China in the early 1990s and quickly gained millions of followers. We trace the origins of Falun Gong’s founder and leader, Li Hongzhi, and his teachings that combine meditation, moral philosophy, and supernatural claims. We also examine how Falun Gong attracted the attention and ire of the Chinese Communist Party, which launched a brutal crackdown on the movement in 1999, banning it as an “evil cult” and subjecting its practitioners to imprisonment, torture, and organ harvesting.Music credit:80s Crime Thriller Soundtrack Playlist - Vice Beach // Royalty Free Copyright Safe MusicWhite Bat Audio
